bill.title: NETWORK ADEQUACY&TRANSPARENCY
bill.abstract: Amends the Network Adequacy and Transparency Act. Provides that the Act does not apply to an individual or group policy for dental or vision insurance. Provides that a network plan shall not be subject to any fines or penalties for information that the provider submits that is inaccurate or incomplete. Effective immediately.

bill.title: An Act relative to certain affordable housing in the Jamaica Plain section of the city of Boston
bill.abstract: Exempts the construction and development of the Armory Street public housing project in the Jamaica Plain section of the city of Boston from procurement and contracting laws; subjects the projects to various labor laws pertaining to construction of public works, including priority for veterans and citizens, use of job lists and job classifications, and wage determinations; further subjects the project to laws regulating construction and materials contracts if the project is funded in part by state or federal government low-income housing tax credits, grant, loan, or tax-exempt bonds; imposes requirements of the uniform procurement act if the project is subsequently conveyed to an entity that is not part of the Boston Housing Authority.

status.statusval: Laid before the Governor

bill.title: An Act relative to minimum wage, paid family medical leave and the sales tax holiday
bill.abstract: ...With respect to paid family medical leave, the bill authorizes 12 weeks for family leave, 20 weeks for medical leave and up to 26 weeks to cover for a service member on leave. In the aggregate, an employee may not receive more than 26 weeks total in a year from any combination of leave taking. Employee\'s would be eligible for leave to take care of a newborn or newly adopted child, to deal with a health issue, to care for a family member or to deal with a family member\'s absence due to military service.\rWith respect to the sales tax holiday, the bill creates a permanent annual sales tax holiday for one weekend each August, as desired by the Retailers Association of Massachusetts, but would not lower the state sales tax. In another concession to businesses, the bill would eliminate time ...

status.statusval: Signed by the Governor
